subtitle: Use firm ripe beef or large tomatoes for this recipe. You can replace the beef with minced chicken or turkey.

method.text: Heat oil in a small frying pan. Add onion and fry for 2 min or until softened. Add beef and mushrooms and fry for 3-5 min or until browned.
Remove from heat. Stir in tomato puree, seasoning and Mozzarella cheese.
Carefully cut a lid off the top of each tomato. Hollow out the tomatoes. Roughly chop the scooped out flesh and add to pan with the mince mixture.
Divide filling between the tomato shells. Arrange in an ovenproof dish and cook in oven for 10-15 min or until warmed through.

Meanwhile using a 7 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>2</sub> cm round cutter, cut rounds (one per serving) from the bread slices. Heat the vegetable oil in a frying pan, add the garlic and shallow fry the bread rounds for 2-3 min, until golden. Remove from pan and drain well on kitchen paper.
Arrange the rounds on a serving plate. Top each with a tomato slice. Serve immediately.

title: Stuffed tomato garlic rounds
